Bittensor

  • Components of a Bittensor Model

Components of a Bittensor Model¶

Now that you’ve familiarized yourself with running Bittensor and the driver code, it’s time we learn how to build a custom model to run on Bittensor. Inside each Synapse, the structure is rather similar with small changes according to modality. In this tutorial, we will cover the FFNN.py Synapse, which is a simple feed-forward neural network that is designed to classify the MNIST dataset. FFNN.py contains the following functions:

Feed Forward NN Synapse

Simple feed forward NN for images.

class bittensor.synapses.ffnn.FFNNSynapse(config: munch.Munch)¶

Simple feed forward NN for images.

forward_image(images: torch.Tensor)¶

Forward image inputs through the FFNN synapse .

Parameters

inputs (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, sequence_dim, channels, rows, cols), required) – Image tensors produced by calling PIL.toTensor() and with sequence dimension.

Returns

Hidden layer encoding produced by using local_context.

Return type

hidden (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, sequence_dim, bittensor.__network_dim__), required)

local_forward(images: torch.Tensor, targets: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None) → types.SimpleNamespace¶

Forward pass non-sequential image inputs and targets through the FFNN Synapse. The call does not make remote queries to the network and returns only local hidden, target and losses.

Parameters

  • images (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, channels, rows, cols), required) – PIL.toTensor() encoded images.

  • targets (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, target_dim), optional, defaults to None) – Image labels.

Returns

Pre-Hidden layer context, trained to match the remote context.

local_hidden (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, bittensor.__network_dim__), required):

Hidden layer produced from the context.

local_target (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, target_dim), optional):

FFNN Target predictions using local_context.

local_target_loss (torch.FloatTensor of shape (1), optional):

FFNN Classification loss using local_context.

local_accuracy (torch.FloatTensor of shape (1), optional):

Accuracy of target predictions.

Return type

local_context (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, bittensor.__network_dim__), required)

remote_forward(neuron: bittensor.neuron.Neuron, images: torch.Tensor, targets: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None) → types.SimpleNamespace¶

Forward pass non-sequential image inputs and targets through the remote context of the synapse. The call makes RPC queries accross the network using the passed neuron’s metagraph and dendrite.

Parameters

  • ( (neuron) – obj: bittensor.Neuron, required): Bittensor neuron, used for making queries to the remote network.

  • images (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, channels, rows, cols), required) – PIL.toTensor() encoded images.

  • targets (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, target_dim), optional, defaults to None) – Image labels.

Returns

Outputs from the pkm dendrite remote call.

distillation_loss (torch.FloatTensor of shape (1), optional):

Distillation loss between the local and remote context.

remote_hidden (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, bittensor.__network_dim__), optional):

Hidden layer encoding produced using the remote context.

remote_target (torch.FloatTensor of shape (batch_size, target_dim), optional):

FFNN Target predictions using the remote_context.

remote_target_loss (torch.FloatTensor of shape (1), optional):

FFNN Classification loss using the remote_context.

Return type

dendrite (SimpleNamespace, required)
